definition: can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])
to check/to verify/to test/to examine/to take an exam/to take an entrance exam for/deceased father

sentences.english: I knew you dace your test.
With four As in the HKALE, Anthony had several options.
sentences.chinese: 陳子量在高級程度會考拿了四個甲，本應有很多選擇。

sentences.english: If you take(follow) my advice, you'll pass the exam.
sentences.chinese: 如果你聽我的勸告，你會考及格。

sentences.english: He'll do well in the exams.
LH: I think that maybe I would have had an Art degree.
sentences.chinese: 我想也許我會考獲藝術學士的學位，現在當了油畫家。

sentences.english: Enter "Y" if you will take HKCEE in 2009.
sentences.chinese: 將參加2009年香港中學會考，請填“Y”。

sentences.english: I want to apply to a Canadian university. Do I need four provincial courses?
sentences.chinese: 報考加拿大的大學需要通過四科省級會考嗎？

sentences.english: The school will issue a school report to each of you on the date of releasing HKCEE result slips.
sentences.chinese: 學校將於香港中學會考放榜當日派發學校成績表。

sentences.english: I knew you'd ace your test.
The course is compulsory for all students and the score will be on their high school transcripts.
sentences.chinese: 該課程是會考科目，任何學生不得免考。

sentences.english: Jack is very nervous because he thinks he will fail, and the test is very important.
sentences.chinese: 傑克很擔心明天會考砸，而且這次考試非常之重要。

sentences.english: You will pass the examination if you take my advice and study hard.
sentences.chinese: 如果你聽我的勸告用功讀書，你就會考及格。

sentences.english: Children may leave schools at sixteen without taking part in the public examination.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們可在十六歲畢業而不須參加會考。

sentences.english: I have already finished my HKCEE.
sentences.chinese: 我已經完成了我的中學會考。

sentences.english: I must work hard, or I'll fail in the exam.
sentences.chinese: 我必須好好學習，否則我會考不及格了。

sentences.english: If you take my advice and study hard, you will pass the examination.
sentences.chinese: 假如你聽我的勸告用功讀書就會考及格。

definition: to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
to fight for/to strive for/to win over
to call into question/to question (truth or validity)
to have sth to do with/to relate to/related to/to concern/concerning
